dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2011, Americans for Job Security finally had to the FEC who their donors were, after years of litigation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty eleven, Americans for Job Security finally had to the F E C who their donors were, after years of litigation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But after years of litigation, CREW convinced the Federal Election Commission otherwise. AJS filed a list of its backers and beneficiaries from 2010 to 2012 on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's a huge deal because this is actually the first time a dark money group was forced to disclose donors in the Citizens United era.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's a huge deal because this is actually the first time a dark money group was forced to disclose donors in the Citizens United era.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is the first time in the Citizens United-era that a dark money group was forced to disclose their donors in a certain time period, said Jordan Libowitz, a spokesperson for nonprofit watchdog group Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington, referring to the 2010 Supreme Court case that wiped away previous restrictions on political spending.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the list they filed covers from 2008 to 2011—and some of these names are just staggering. Warren Buffett gave nearly $15 million over just three months in 2011.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the list they filed covers from two thousand eight to twenty eleven-and some of these names are just staggering. Warren Buffett gave nearly fifteen dollars million over just three months in twenty eleven.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: AJS filed a list of its backers and beneficiaries from 2010 to 2012 on Thursday. The biggest individual donor to the group appears to be Charles Schwab, the brokerage titan worth an estimated $7.8 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's an insane amount of money. And then Steve Jobs and his wife Laurene Powell Jobs donated another $10 million, which is, like, massive too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's an insane amount of money. And then Steve Jobs and his wife Laurene Powell Jobs donated another ten dollars million, which is, like, massive too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Gap cofounder Doris Fisheralong with her sons Robert, John and Williamgave another $9 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it wasn't just tech and finance—George Soros gave $2 million in December 2011, and even Rex Tillerson, the former Exxon CEO, was on there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it wasn't just tech and finance-George Soros gave two dollars million in December twenty eleven, and even Rex Tillerson, the former Exxon C E O, was on there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The late Republican megadonors Richard and Helen DeVos gave $1 million to the group in October 2012. Texas oil-and-gas billionaires Richard Kinder, Dan Wilks, Farris Wilks and late Houston Texans owner Robert McNair were also among the donors that year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and Donald Trump and Melania Trump donated as well, which is interesting given he later appointed her to an official role.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and Donald Trump and Melania Trump donated as well, which is interesting given he later appointed her to an official role.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: WWE chief executive Vince McMahon donated, along with his wife Linda McMahon, who Donald Trump later appointed to his cabinet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that definitely raises some eyebrows. And then you've got other billionaires like Michael Dell and Jeff Bezos on the list too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that definitely raises some eyebrows. And then you've got other billionaires like Michael Dell and Jeff Bezos on the list too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Others include Dennis Washington of Montana, who got rich in mining and railroads, and Leon Black of New York, who cofounded private equity giant Apollo.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's not just individuals though—companies like Tesla and Walmart also contributed. Tesla gave $100,000, Walmart $10,000.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's not just individuals though-companies like Tesla and Walmart also contributed. Tesla gave one hundred thousand dollars, Walmart ten thousand dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companies of several billionaires are also on the list, including Wynn Resorts, which was cofounded by billionaire Steve Wynn and his then-wife Elaine Wynn (Steve Wynn resigned as chairman and CEO in February 2018 and sold all his Wynn Resorts shares), and Bass Pro Shops, the sporting goods retailer founded and majority owned by billionaire John Morris. Wynn Resorts contributed $500,000 and Bass Pro Shops contributed $50,000 in 2012.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is wild because Warren Buffett, who's a major Walmart shareholder, also personally donated another $10,000 on top of that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is wild because Warren Buffett, who's a major Walmart shareholder, also personally donated another ten thousand dollars on top of that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Wynn Resorts contributed $500,000 and Bass Pro Shops contributed $50,000 in 2012. (Morris himself contributed another $50,000, according to the filing.)

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So this group, Americans for Job Security, had been arguing for years they weren't political and didn't have to disclose anything. But CREW, that watchdog group, really pushed this through.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this group, Americans for Job Security, had been arguing for years they weren't political and didn't have to disclose anything. But C R E W, that watchdog group, really pushed this through.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Americans for Job Security had previously claimed it was not a political organization and therefore did not have to disclose its donors. But after years of litigation, CREW convinced the Federal Election Commission otherwise.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and according to their spokesperson Jordan Libowitz, this sets a new precedent for dark money transparency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and according to their spokesperson Jordan Libowitz, this sets a new precedent for dark money transparency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is the first time in the Citizens United-era that a dark money group was forced to disclose their donors in a certain time period, said Jordan Libowitz, a spokesperson for nonprofit watchdog group Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington, referring to the 2010 Supreme Court case that wiped away previous restrictions on political spending.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, the fact that Rupert Murdoch himself, as AJS president, had to compile this from bank records and spreadsheets… it feels like a small but significant crack in the system.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, the fact that Rupert Murdoch himself, as A J S president, had to compile this from bank records and spreadsheets... it feels like a small but significant crack in the system.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a letter to the FEC, AJS president Stephen DeMaura said the list was pulled from bank records, spreadsheets and other records, noting that it probably included some duplicates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Even if there might be duplicates, as Murdoch noted, it's more disclosure than we've ever had from one of these groups.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Even if there might be duplicates, as Murdoch noted, it's more disclosure than we've ever had from one of these groups.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a letter to the FEC, AJS president Stephen DeMaura said the list was pulled from bank records, spreadsheets and other records, noting that it probably included some duplicates.

artist_script:
Back in 2011, Americans for Job Security finally had to the FEC who their donors were, after years of litigation.
HostB: Yeah, and it’s a huge deal because this is actually the first time a dark money group was forced to disclose donors in the Citizens United era.
HostA: Right, and the list they filed covers from 2008 to 2011—and some of these names are just staggering. Warren Buffett gave nearly $15 million over just three months in 2011.
HostB: Wow, that’s an insane amount of money. And then Steve Jobs and his wife Laurene Powell Jobs donated another $10 million, which is, like, massive too.
HostA: And it wasn’t just tech and finance—George Soros gave $2 million in December 2011, and even Rex Tillerson, the former Exxon CEO, was on there.
HostB: Oh, and Donald Trump and Melania Trump donated as well, which is interesting given he later appointed her to an official role.
HostA: Yeah, that definitely raises some eyebrows. And then you’ve got other billionaires like Michael Dell and Jeff Bezos on the list too.
HostB: It’s not just individuals though—companies like Tesla and Walmart also contributed. Tesla gave $100,000, Walmart $10,000.
HostA: Which is wild because Warren Buffett, who’s a major Walmart shareholder, also personally donated another $10,000 on top of that.
HostB: So this group, Americans for Job Security, had been arguing for years they weren’t political and didn’t have to disclose anything. But CREW, that watchdog group, really pushed this through.
HostA: Exactly, and according to their spokesperson Jordan Libowitz, this sets a new precedent for dark money transparency.
HostB: I mean, the fact that Rupert Murdoch himself, as AJS president, had to compile this from bank records and spreadsheets… it feels like a small but significant crack in the system.
HostA: For sure. Even if there might be duplicates, as Murdoch noted, it’s more disclosure than we’ve ever had from one of these groups.
